item.title: S1E0 - Introduction
item.description: So - we are about to set foot in the Twelve Duchies for the first time. I have three characters already, taken from the fiction that I wrote years ago. I’m going to start with a sort of solo session zero and outline a bit about them. I’m being intentionally brief - I don’t want to spend too much time on it as I’d rather details emerge through the story.

item.title: Journal Entry Five
item.description: I’m really hungry. Just been rooting about in the cupboards and found a few things. A packet of stale biscuits (ate them - they were ok, better than nothing) and a deck of cards.

item.title: Journal Entry Four
item.description: It’s 6:23am and I’m freezing. I managed to keep the fire going but the wind from the bust roof was howling through the cabin all night and I just couldn’t get warm.

item.title: Journal Entry Three
item.description: Dammit! The day started so well! Managed to get the fire going and it lasted until first light, around 8am. The dawn was spectacular - the cabin must be facing southeast because the sun rose over the mountains away to the left.

item.title: Journal Entry Two
item.description: Man it’s cold!!! I must have fallen asleep last night. The fire’s almost out and it looks like the snow really came down during the night as there are 6 foot drifts outside.

item.title: Journal Entry One
item.description: Wow! This place is amazing! It took a while to get here - snow on the roads and it’s pretty remote. Google maps took me the wrong way and I ended up at a gate on a cliff - had to find my own way for the last hour or so.

item.title: S01E01 - Arrival In Kethryn
item.description: The Running Hind heels gently in the westerly breeze, canvas full and humming as she glides toward the wooden sea wall surrounding the Kethryn docks. Sunlight flashes off the brackish water of the lake and glimmers of the drenched wooden pylons of the great sea gate, its massive door standing open allowing passage for the fishing boats and merchant ships that frequent these waters.
